articles.author: Leika Kihara, Takahiko Wada
articles.description: Japan's core inflation slowed sharply in November to a pace unseen in over a year, data showed on Friday, highlighting easing cost-push pressures that may give the central bank more time before phasing out its massive monetary stimulus.
articles.title: Japan's core inflation slows in November, eases pressure on BOJ

articles.author: Siyi Liu, Dominique Patton
articles.description: China, the world's top processor of rare earths, on Thursday banned the export of technology to extract and separate the strategic metals, in a further step towards protecting its dominance in several strategic metals.
articles.title: China bans export of rare earth processing tech over national security

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The company that owns and operates adult entertainment websites including Pornhub.com will pay $1.8 million to the U.S. government to resolve a probe into its ties to an alleged sex trafficking operation, federal prosecutors said on Thursday.
articles.title: Pornhub owner pays $1.8 mln to resolve US probe of sex trafficking ties

articles.author: Nichola Groom, Cath Turner
articles.description: The angular, polarizing design of the Cybertruck will help boost the Tesla brand, the electric vehicle maker's chief designer said on Thursday, adding that the pickup was no experiment.
articles.title: Cybertruck designer says Tesla stainless steel pickup is no experiment

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: The U.S. Transportation Department is scrutinizing the frequent flyer programs of major U.S. airlines for potential deceptive or unfair practices, the agency said Thursday as regulators step up oversight of the airline industry.
articles.title: Exclusive: US scrutinizing airline frequent flyer programs

articles.author: Deborah Sophia
articles.description: Nike (NKE.N) on Thursday trimmed its annual sales forecast blaming cautious consumer spending, a weaker online business and more promotions, and said it plans to cut supplies of key product lines to manage costs, sending its shares down 11%.
articles.title: Nike cuts sales view on choppy demand, outlines $2 bln savings plan

articles.author: Bassam Massoud, Maggie Fick
articles.description: In the morgue of the Nasser Hospital, in southern Gaza, workers wrap the corpses of people killed in Israeli airstrikes in white cloth amid the stench of death. They record whatever basic facts they can about the dead: name, identity card number, age, sex.
articles.title: Gaza death toll: why counting the dead has become a daily struggle

articles.author: Phil Stewart, Doina Chiacu
articles.description: The top U.S. military officer held a virtual meeting with his Chinese counterpart on Thursday, the Pentagon said, in the first such conversation in over a year amid hopes by U.S. officials that it could lead to a broader restoration of ties between the two militaries.
articles.title: US, China top military officials speak for first time in over a year

articles.author: Joseph Ax
articles.description: Three Tacoma, Washington, police officers were acquitted on Thursday in the killing of Manuel Ellis, an unarmed Black man whose dying pleas for air sparked protests in 2020, in a case bearing parallels to the murder of George Floyd that year.
articles.title: Three Washington state police officers acquitted in killing of Black man

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A new reactor at North Korea's Yongbyon nuclear complex appears to be operating for the first time, the U.N. nuclear watchdog and independent experts said on Thursday, which would mean an additional potential source of plutonium for nuclear weapons.
articles.title: Second North Korean nuclear reactor appears to be operational, IAEA says
